tossups.question: When a character with this profession asks if a "protoplasmic manifestation" can expect "the milk of human kindness," another character responds, "Milk of human fiddlesticks." In another play, a character with this profession twice denies having asked Shamraeff to stuff an animal. A character with this profession angrily complains about "infring[ing] the monopoly" soon after another character recites, "Satan, my mighty foe, advances; I see his dread and lurid eyes." A character with this profession invites (*) Dr. Bradman to a seance held by Madame Arcati. The supposed shattering of a medicine bottle is used by Dr. Dorn to cover up the suicide of an aspirant to this profession to Arkadina. Treplev and Trigorin have this profession in The Seagull. For 10 points, name this profession, a member of which is searched for by six characters in a Pirandello play.
tossups.answer: an author [or a writer or a novelist or a playwright or literally anything along those lines]
tossups.answer_formatted: an author [or a writeror a novelistor a playwright or literally anything along those lines]

tossups.question: This thinker investigated the relation between confessions and archives in the essay "Typewriter Ribbon." This thinker proclaimed that today, more than ever, "this predilection [for paradox and aporia] remains a requirement." The second half of a work by this thinker used "logic of supplementarity" to analyze Jean-Jacques Rousseau's Essay on the Origin of Languages. This thinker introduced the idea of (*) iterability to emphasize that words must be repeatable. This thinker responded to Michel Foucault in the essay "Cogito and the History of Madness." This thinker claimed that "there is nothing outside of texts." This thinker argued that writing is traditionally secondary to speech. For 10 points, name this French author of On Grammatology who introduced deconstructionism.
tossups.answer: Jacques Derrida

tossups.question: This character sings one aria over a bass playing the quarter notes [read slowly] "G F-sharp G D E-flat B-flat C D low D." This character proclaims that she will die during a scene overlaid by a chromatic descent from G to D played by a bass. In one recitative, this character asks Belinda, who attends this character alongside the Second Woman, for her hand as she foresees her death. This character sings the words (*) "Remember me!" twice on the note D in a 6/4 passage, before telling the audience "Ah, but forget my fate." This character sings the lament "When I am laid in Earth," written by Nahum Tate, in one opera. This character kills herself to end the most famous opera by Hector Berlioz. For 10 points, name this queen of Carthage paired with Aeneas in the title of a Henry Purcell opera.
tossups.answer: Dido [accept Elissa]

tossups.question: One model of this process takes on a "top hat" profile and uses an entrainment velocity. A body is stable against this process if negative dT over dZ is less than g over heat capacity; that is Schwarzschild's criterion. This process is characterized by high values of h times the characteristic length divided by k, which equals the (*) Nusselt number. The formation of Benard cells is one indication of this process. This process can be "free" or "forced" depending on whether differences in density or external forces drive it. The presence of this process in the mantle is primarily responsible for plate tectonics. This process is a combination of advection and heat diffusion. For 10 points, name this process of heat transfer caused by the bulk motion of fluid.
tossups.answer: convection [prompt on heat transfer]

tossups.question: The kingdom of Jaya Stithi, who ruled in this modern-day country, was divided by his son Yaksha, ending that dynasty's unity. The Kirat people were the main ethnic group in the early history of this country. Both the Licchavi and Malla dynasties ruled a highly populated region in the center of this country. The (*) Rana dynasty held real power in this country under the descendants of Prithvi Narayan Shah, who is credited with unifying this country. The claimed birthplace of the Buddha lies in this country's area of Lumbini. This country was invaded by the British after it invaded neighbouring Sikkim, although it later enjoyed a close relationship with Britain, for whom it supplied Gurkha soldiers. For 10 points, name this country whose capital is Kathmandu.
tossups.answer: Nepal

tossups.question: A poem by this author describes "Bubbles that glitter as they rise and break / on vain Philosophy's aye- babbling spring." One of this author's poems criticizes the depiction of a bird in "Il Penseroso" as "most musical, most melancholy." This poet's experiment in Pantisocracy with Robert Southey led to him meeting his future wife, whom he addressed in one poem as "My pensive Sara!" An unfinished poem by this author is described as (*) "a vision in a dream. A Fragment." That opium-inspired poem by this author describes an "Abyssinian maid" with a dulcimer who sang of "Mount Abora," but was left unfinished because of a "person from Porlock." For 10 points, name this British Romantic poet of conversation poems like "The Nightingale" and "The Eolian Harp," who wrote of "the sacred river Alph" and "a stately pleasure-dome" in "Kubla Khan."
tossups.answer: Samuel Taylor Coleridge

tossups.question: This religious denomination always sings a hymn whose title translates as "The Praise Song" and comes from believers imprisoned in Passau as the second song in a service. This denomination emerged from congregations that opposed Hans Reist. This denomination, whose main hymnal is called the Ausbund, includes sects named for Swartzentruber, Beachy, and (*) Elkhart-LaGrange. For this denomination, there is less emphasis on young people obeying the Ordnung during the period of rumspringa. Like the related Mennonites, this denomination contains an Old Order movement that still uses horse & buggy transport. tossups.question: These organisms can undergo blastic or thallic development. When these organisms lack septa, they are known as "coenocytic." Some of these organisms reproduce by producing asexual spores called conidia. Some of these organisms can penetrate cortical cells using their arbuscules. One of these organisms located in the Blue Mountains in Oregon is the largest living thing on Earth. Sac-like reproductive features that contain (*) eight spores are characteristic of the largest phylum of these organisms, Ascomycota. This work, which may have been written for Giulietta Guicciardi, had its middle movement dubbed a "flower between two chasms" by Franz Liszt. parts: Name this person who claimed that people grow from the Instrumental-Relativist level as they proceed through the preconventional to postconventional stages.
Kohlberg developed stages of the development of this capacity. This capacity is often illustrated in the "Heinz dilemma", where a husband steals a life-saving drug to save his wife.
Carol Gilligan accused Kohlberg of being biased against women in the book In a Different [one of these things]. The larynx is commonly called this thing's box.
answers: morality [or morals; accept moral development; prompt on ethics]
voice [accept In a Different Voice; accept voice box]

bonuses.leadin: After handing one of these foodstuffs to Clay, Lula notes that "eating [these foodstuffs] together is always the first step" in Amiri Baraka's play Dutchman. For 10 points each:
parts: Name these foodstuffs. Later in Dutchman, Clay references a Hans Christian Andersen tale in which a queen tries to kill her daughter Snow White with a poisoned one of these foodstuffs.

Right before he is stabbed by Lula, Clay rants that this person "would've played not a note of music if he just walked up to East Sixty-seventh Street and killed the first ten white people he saw." This person was the inspiration for Johnny Carter in Julio Cortazar's "The Pursuer."
The beginning of Dutchman is set in one of these locations. A poem titled for one of these locations in Paris compares "faces in the crowd" to "petals on a wet, black bough."
answers: a subway station [accept a metro station, prompt on answers like a train station]
answers_formatted: a subway station [accept a metro station, prompt on answers like a train station]
acceptable: metro station, prompt on answers like a train station

bonuses.leadin: This event is considered the beginning of the Reforma. For 10 points each:
parts: Name this event led by liberals like Ignacio Comonfort that indicted a leader for selling the Mesilla Valley. This event would be followed three years later by the Plan of Tacubaya.

The Plan of Ayutla led to the instatement of this president after Comonfort resigned. This person also ruled over a conflict between the Liberal Party and Conservative Party that was sparked by the Constitution of 1857.
Benito Juarez succeeded this president who massacred Texans at the Battle of the Alamo.
answers: Plan of Ayutla [accept Revolution of Ayutla]
